unnormalised: Surat, Gujarat – Recent reports indicate increasing pressure on quality control measures within the diamond manufacturing sector in Surat. Industry analysts, including Dr. Patel from IIM Ahmedabad, point to fluctuating global demand and rising material costs as key stressors impacting QC processes.

unnormalised: Several leading manufacturers, including Kiran Gems, are reportedly investing in advanced optical scanning technologies to improve defect detection rates. However, smaller players are struggling to implement robust QC systems due to financial constraints.

unnormalised: A recent industry forum held in Mumbai highlighted the need for standardized quality control certifications, potentially mirroring the ISO 9001 standards. Concerns were raised regarding the consistency of grading reports, impacting consumer trust.
